Key Match Events: West Indies won by 2 wickets with 7 balls remaining.
West Indies chased down the target of 153 in 18.5 overs, scoring 155/8.
Pre-Game Insights: Batters were in focus as West Indies looked to go back-to-back against India.
India considered bringing in Jaiswal for one of the wristspinners due to a longish tail in Tarouba.
Romario Shepherd has a strike rate of 205.88 in the last five overs in T20Is this year, the second-best for any batter to have faced at least 30 deliveries in that phase.
Hardik Pandya's recent form shows a strike rate of only 106.31 in the middle overs since the T20Is against New Zealand last November.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell emphasized the importance of batting spin well during the middle overs for their success.
Post-Match Reflections: India seamer Arshdeep Singh praised newcomer Tilak Varma for his performance despite the pressure of a run chase.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain was expected, with two of the last five T20Is at Providence Stadium in Guyana being washed out.
The scores batting first in the three completed games at Providence Stadium were 146, 157, and 163, with the chasing team winning twice.
Kuldeep Yadav is one of the four bowlers with an average less than 15 and an economy rate under seven while playing for Full Members in T20Is.
Kyle Mayers averages only 20.81 as an opener in T20Is, the second-lowest for any West Indies batter to have opened at least 20 times in the format.
No member from India's playing XI in the 2019 T20I at Providence is part of the squad for the ongoing T20I series.
